result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Linzey Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to sentence in case #20CF3123; Court allows for Good Time Credit
**11-03-2022/Judge Danielle L. Shelton - Court orders JOC amended by commuting the term of probation on count 2 to one year.**

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Court waived all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due to a finding of indigency.

- Complete a Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment.
- Obtain a valid driver's license.
- Complete a Cognitive Thinking Program.
COURT ALLOWS FOR EXPUNGEMENT IF THE DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES PROBATION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Linzey Turner

records.addlTxt: reflects court order signed 11-03-2022 by commuting the probation on count 2 to one year

Received and Filed:  Decision Commuting Probation and Order Amending Judgment of Conviction. 
Copy sent to DOC.  Case forwarded to Clerk's Office for processing.
Filed:  Proposed Decision Commuting Probation and Order Amending Judgment of Conviction.
Letter from DOC seeking review of probation term

Defendant Timothy Linzey Turner appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Timothy Linzey Turner.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Court holds colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to appear in person before the Court. Court finds defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to appear in person before the Court and agrees to proceed electronically via Zoom.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to sentence in case #20CF3123.  Court allows for good time credit. 

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Complete 40 hours of community service. 
- Complete a mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Obtain a HS diploma/GED/HSED. 
- Complete a cognitive thinking program. 

*Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation. 

Court waived all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due to a finding of indigency. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Timothy Linzey Turner appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Hotchkiss appeared by video for Timothy Linzey Turner.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Not guilty plea entered on behalf of the defendant as to misdemeanor Count 2.  Defense advised the Court that this matter will resolve globally with case #20CF3123 and Defense will waive a preliminary hearing.  Court set a plea/sentencing date upon request from the defense.  Court does not set bail.  Court does not set a preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Timothy Linzey Turner in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Timothy Linzey Turner in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court with Defendants other case 20CF3123. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of Global resolution with Defendant's other case 20CF3123 and requested an adjourned initial appearance. State Confirmed. Court GRANTED Defense's request. Case adjourned for Initial Appearance, Branch 40. Initial Appearance scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 3:00 pm. Defendant will appear Via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant Timothy Linzey Turner in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Timothy Linzey Turner in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/26/22 @ 1:30p
